title.rendered: 150+ Online Classes Can Help You Become A Better Parent

content.rendered:
You probably know that there are plenty of online courses to teach you data analysis or computer programming, but did you know that there are also many online classes that can teach you to be a better parent?

At Class Central, we scoured the catalog to find courses on subjects ranging from nutrition during pregnancy to child development, teaching your child to read and draw, plus health care, special needs, and first aid. As with so many other topics, it turns out that if there’s a parenting topic that interests you, it’s likely that there’s a course for it. Here are all the free and paid parenting courses Class Central was able to uncover.

While some of these courses are primarily designed for teachers or health professionals, parents may also be interested.

Have you taken one of these courses? Be sure to leave a review that can help other parents and parents-to-be decide which courses to take.

Index

Click on a category to jump to the corresponding section and resources.

  • General Parenting [39]
  • Child Development [5]
  • Learning [46]
  • Nutrition [8]
  • Physical and Mental Health [32]
  • Special Needs [24]

If you don’t find what you need in the course list below, Class Central’s got you covered. Browse our catalog of 100K courses or visit our thematic collections:

  • 100+ Free Online Courses on Mindfulness & Happiness
  • 175+ Free Online Writing Courses to Improve Your Skills
  • 100+ Psychology Courses You Can Take for Free
  • Massive List of Thousands of Free Certificates and Badges
  • 150+ Online Courses To Help Your Career

General Parenting

The Best Start in Life: Early Childhood Development for Sustainable Development
SDG Academy via edX
Children are our future – so how do we give them the best beginning for a happy and healthy life?

Positive Behavior Support for Young Children
University of Washington via edX
Learn the evidence-based models to promote social-emotional development for young children.
★★★★☆ (5 ratings)

The Science of Parenting
University of California, San Diego via edX
Move beyond the chatter and opinion surrounding parenting and learn about the scientific findings and data that can help you make sensible, informed parenting decisions.
★★★★☆ (2 ratings)

Everyday Parenting: The ABCs of Child Rearing
Yale University via Coursera
Everyday Parenting gives you access to a toolkit of behavior-change techniques that will make your typical day in the home easier as you develop the behaviors you would like to see in your child.
★★★★★ (3 ratings)

Exploring Play: The Importance of Play in Everyday Life
The University of Sheffield via FutureLearn
Understanding the nature and value of play through the course of our lives, across cultures and communities.
★★★★★ (136 ratings)

Children and Climate Change
United Nations via Independent
This course presents how children and youth can be impacted by climate change, how their resilience to climate change can be strengthened, and how they can act on climate change.

Child Development

via YouTube
In this course, you will learn about Child Development and Pedagogy. You will learn about growth and development, heredity and environment, principles of development, teaching methods, socialisation, and much more.

Child development
via Swayam
The course gives insight into the growth and development from conception to adolescence. It covers physical, emotional, language, cognitive, moral and social development from infancy to adolescence. The course also deals with children with special needs. The different development challenges in children like visual, hearing, intellectual disabilities, symptoms and causes.
★★★★☆ (1 rating)

BES-121: Childhood and Growing Up
IGNOU via Swayam
The Course offers an introduction to the study of childhood, child development and adolescence. It aims to make you think effectively about the developmental process of the child and the interplay of poverty, class and gender in child development.

Supporting children’s development is an introductory course for anyone who is interested in children’s development, especially support staff in schools, such as teaching assistants. It builds on …

C’est pourquoi nous avons créé ce MOOC qui réunit des experts du Trouble du Spectre de l’Autisme (TSA) et se base sur des faits scientifiquement prouvés.

Understanding Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI)
University of Tasmania via Independent

University of Geneva via Coursera
Suite à un premier MOOC sur le diagnostic des Troubles du Spectre de l’Autisme (TSA), nous vous proposons un deuxième volet axé sur la biologie et les neurosciences du TSA. Différents sujets seront ainsi discutés par des experts dans les domaines scientifiques qui ont connu une formidable avancée au cours de ces dernières années et ont amené un nouveau regard sur l’autisme.

Troubles du spectre de l’autisme : interventions
University of Geneva via Coursera
Pour ce troisième MOOC de l’Université de Genève sur les Troubles du Spectre de l’Autisme (TSA), nous vous proposons un volet axé sur l’intervention, l’accompagnement et le traitement dans le domaine des TSA.

Autism Awareness Course for Parents – Autism Training
via Udemy
Training Helps Parents Reduce Challenging Autism Behavior Learn to Understand & Manage Autism and Autistic Children

Managing Asthma, Allergies, Diabetes, and Seizures in School
University of Colorado System via Coursera
In this course, you will learn about these common medical issues students face and how to best support students who suffer from them. We will also take a holistic look at how we can best support overall student health.
★★★★★ (1 rating)

Health Across the Gender Spectrum
Stanford University via Coursera
This course offers an intimate, story-based introduction to the experiences of six transgender children and their families. Through illustrated stories and short teaching videos, learners will gain a better understanding of gender identity and the gender spectrum.
★★★★★ (5 ratings)

Health Across the Gender Spectrum
Stanford University via edX
This course offers an intimate, story-based introduction to the experiences of six transgender children and their families. Through illustrated stories and short teaching videos, learners will gain a better understanding of gender identity and the gender spectrum.
★★★★★ (2 ratings)

Understanding Inclusive Education: Children’s Individuality
The Open University via FutureLearn
Explore inclusive education from a unique child’s viewpoint to realise the benefits of a child-centric approach.

Oral Health Care for Autistic Children
The University of Hong Kong via edX
Make a difference in the oral health care of autistic children and bring a happy smile with positive behavioural management and minimally clinical intervention.

excerpt.rendered: Courses on subjects ranging from nutrition during pregnancy to teaching your child to read to health care and first aid.
